timeline.author: sqrrm

replies.bodyText: I will make a commit with the suggestion. Have better control if I do it in the IDE...
replies.author: chimp1984

replies.bodyText: Yes, I only make the code suggestion here as a way to explain more precisely what I mean. Best do it on your own to be sure it's correct.
replies.author: sqrrm

timeline.author: sqrrm

timeline.bodyText: Timeout unit should be sec, is this a test artefact together with the error log level?
timeline.author: sqrrm

timeline.bodyText: That's quite a bit of logging but perhaps ok since it's once per received block
timeline.author: sqrrm

replies.bodyText: We can lower loglevel once we see that the feature works more reliable. Prefer to keep it now.
replies.author: chimp1984

timeline.author: sqrrm

replies.bodyText: Found more like that. Will fix in new commit.
replies.author: chimp1984

timeline.author: sqrrm

replies.bodyText: I prefer to not return early here as this style is commonly used in many places and often there are several if else branches. It is more like a dispatcher or switch case style (if switch would be more flexible in java). I prefer to use the early return for validation use cases but here its more to select the msg we are interested in.
replies.author: chimp1984

replies.bodyText: That's a good point. Might be cleaner to make a handleGetBlocksResponse(GetBlocksResponse r) and other respective dispatch handlers like is done in the trade protocol for these cases.
replies.author: sqrrm

timeline.bodyText:
Doesn't timeoutTimer need to be stopped here like before?
        stopTimeoutTimer();
timeline.author: sqrrm

replies.bodyText: cleanup calls stopTimeoutTimer. But will consolidate cancel/stop/cleanup
replies.author: chimp1984

timeline.message:

Fix leftovers from debugging.
Use else if
